question: The EXIM Bank has recently extended $ 35.8 million Line of Credit to which South-American country, to fund its rural electrification programme?
explanation:
The Export-Import Bank of India (EXIM Bank), on behalf of the Indian Government has extended a Line of Credit of $ 35.80 million to the Suriname. The LOC was provided to fund the rural electrification programme in 50 remote villages of the South American country.
With the recent signing of the agreement, the Indian government has extended nine LOCs to Suriname till date, amounting to $124.98 million. The Exim bank has also extended a total of 258 LOCs to 64 countries across the world.
